thorwin.math.geo

Class Octree<D extends Volume>

  • java.lang.Object
    • thorwin.math.geo.Octree<D>

  • public final class Octree<D extends Volume>
extends java.lang.Object
    A loose Octree implementation of 3D bounding boxes. Can be used to perform various, high performing selections. The octree is fully immutable.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Octree(AABB bounds)
      Constructs a new bounding box with the specified boundary.
      Octree(AABB bounds, double looseness, int maxBoundedShape3Ds)
      Constructs a new bounding box with the specified boundary.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Octree

        public Octree(AABB bounds)
        Constructs a new bounding box with the specified boundary.
        Parameters:
        bounds - bounding box of the root of this octree

      • Octree

        public Octree(AABB bounds,
              double looseness,
              int maxBoundedShape3Ds)
        Constructs a new bounding box with the specified boundary.
        Parameters:
        bounds - bounding box of the root of this octree
        looseness - looseness factor to use
        maxBoundedShape3Ds - maximum number of entries a leaf may hold before splitting it

    • Method Detail

      • getBounds

        public AABB getBounds()
        Returns the bounding box of this octree
        Returns:
        bounding box

      • select

        public java.util.List<D> select(AABB bounds)
        Selects all objects intersecting the specified bounds.
        Parameters:
        bounds - bounding box to select
        Returns:
        list of selected objects

      • delete

        public Octree<D> delete(D data)
        Removes an entry. Note that this removal will not reduce the depth of the octree.
        Parameters:
        data - entry to remove
        Returns:
        modified octree

      • insert

        public Octree<D> insert(java.util.Collection<D> data)
        Inserts a collection of data. This method is the preferred way of inserting data into an octree.
        Parameters:
        data - data to insert
        Returns:
        octree

      • insertData

        public Octree<D> insertData(java.util.List<D> data)
        Inserts a collection of data. This method is the preferred way of inserting data into an octree.
        Parameters:
        data - data to insert
        Returns:
        octree

      • insert

        public Octree<D> insert(D entry)
        Inserts the entry into the octree. As the octree is immutable, a new octree instance is returned.
        Parameters:
        entry - entry (not null)
        Returns:
        The new octree, if the entry can actually be inserted to the octree (will return 'this' otherwise).

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object

      • depth

        public int depth()
        Returns the depth the octree.
        Returns:
        depth

      • maxEntries

        public int maxEntries()
        Returns the maximum entries stored in a single node for this tree. The maximum entries in a node is a performance indicator for the octree.
        Returns:
        maximum entries in node

      • totalAt

        public int totalAt(int level)
        Returns the total of entries stored at the specified level in the tree. This is a performance indicator for the octree.
        Parameters:
        level - depth level to query
        Returns:
        number of entries at level

      • size

        public int size()
        Returns the number of entries in this octree. This method calculates the size by iterating recursively over the entire octree. This means that this method is only intended for debugging purposes.
        Returns:
        number of entries in this octree.
